location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 6755/37 'Consular: Funds held by H.M. Consular Officers on behalf of the Government of India'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 22; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of correspondence regarding a proposal for the certification of cash balances held by HM Consular Officers on behalf of the Government of India. This covers scenarios where consular officers obtained funds directly from the Government of India in advance of expenditure to be incurred on behalf of the Government. The proposal and arrangements for certification are discussed.Correspondents include: the Foreign Office; India Office; Dominions Office; Colonial Office; and the Government of India, External Affairs Department.The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.

name.namePart: Indian Political Service, External Affairs Department
